page.title: 20THE SCHOOL: ST.JOHNS CHAPEL
page.content: The school at St.John's Chapel has 66 children aged from 5-11, 2 teachers, 2 part time teachers and a headmaster. Most of the children come from the villages of St.John's Chapel, Daddry Shield and Westgate but a few come from Ireshopeburn, Wearhead and the surrounding farms. Some children come to school on the bus and some by school taxi. School starts at 9am and finishes at 3.30pm. The lunches are cooked at Stanhope and are brought to school in a van but many of the children prefer to bring their own packed lunch. As well as learning to read, write, and do maths the children have lessons in art, pottery, music, dancing, games and studies(science/histoty/geography) The juniors go swimming at Wolsingham every week . Every Tuesday the local ministers hold a religious service.
